loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mtama

texts.en:
Mtama is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and improved her living standards thanks to her hard work.  She still operates the cafe business and prepares food for her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business

loans.name: Alberto Augusto

texts.pt:
O sr Alberto  é pai de um filho de 4 anos de idade.  ele trabalha  nos caminhos de ferro de mocambique.Para aumentar as suas receitas construiu uma loja de venda de  material de canalizacao no mercado perto de sua casa.
 Com o emprestimo pretende comprar material de canalizacao diverso  como tubos, colas , unioes para revender.
O seu maior sonho é se tornar um negociante de reconhecimento nacional, gostaria tambem de aumentar o tamanho de sua casa.
 Seu maior desafio é pagar o empréstimo com rapidez de forma a solicitar outro.
texts.en:
Alberto is the father of a 4-year-old son. He works for Mozambique Ports and Railways. In order to increase his income, he set up a store that sells piping supplies in the market near his house.
With this loan he intends to purchase a variety of piping supplies such as tubes, adhesive and couplings for re-selling.
His biggest dream is to become a nationally acknowledged retailer. He would also like to enlarge his house.
His biggest challenge is repaying the loan promptly so that he can request another one.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so he can increase turnover in his store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 64 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and pancakes. She also sell prepaid electronic loads to mobile users. Rosita is applying for a loan to buy additional ingredients like sugar, bananas, flour and load wallet reload. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more for more income.  In the future, Rosita hopes to continue to improve her services to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bananas, flour and load wallet reload

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 41 years old. She is a mother of two between the ages of one and eleven. 

She has been selling retail items for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. He has three children. George has been doing agricultural work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming as the "returns gotten from farming." His biggest challenge is "less time." One animal on the farm has been given the name Bogeka.

George was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. He responded that it was due to the low interest rate. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He replied, "It has come to help us."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, George replied it would "'stablize [his] family."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. George owns the following at least one cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and electricity in the household, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old. She is from the municipality of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and nine.  

For ten  years, Juanita has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store where she sell snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. She barely earns an average income of 3,000 PHP that helps sustain her family’s basic needs. 

Juanita is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods. She hopes that in the future she can continue to improve and expand her business for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, chips, detergent, shampoo and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as a place in Liberia. She is 41 years old, married and has a 15-year-old child. Her child is in school and lives at home. Since 2011, she has been selling red oil, rice, coal, etc. in the community market. She learned this way of selling from her mother and started this business with help from her husband. She sells for as long as nine hours per day at her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She likes her business because it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, coal, etc. to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, coal, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 26 years old from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two young children. Liezel’s desire is to help her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, weight leads and to pay for the repair of their fishing boat. Liezel would like to make sure that she can make her business more profitable. Her income will assure her that her children are well provided for and have a healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, weight leads and to pay for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Depporah

texts.en:
Depporah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya which is a popular banana growing region. She has one child and has been doing this work for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea from her personal business; animals on the farm have been given names including "Nyabarati". She stated what is most enjoyable about farming to be selling milk. Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. She notes that her biggest challenge is having capital to expand.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Depporah owns the following: a cow, poultry and motorcycle but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

Depporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan to which she replied, "It's accessible to us in rural areas." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she responded, "They offer us simple and lower interest rate loans." When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Depporah replied, "More income to my family."

loans.use: with the construction of a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mark Jason

texts.en: Mark Jason is a 31-year-old man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with a seven year old daughter. He is asking for a loan to invest in his habal-habal (motorcycle for passengers) business. He will use it to buy a spare tire, chain and motor oil. It will assure him of continued business once this additional capital is available. He hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his child's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, chain and motor oil

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en: Romelyn is 27 years old and is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 3, 4 and 6. Romelyn is engaged in the retailing of purified water to the people around her home. This is the main source of her income. Romelyn  is asking for a loan to pay for water to resell. She hopes her business will be a success and is saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for water needs and consumption

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a native of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 62 years old and is engaged in a sari-sari (general) store business. She sells basic household items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks. She is hoping that with the loan she will not run out of stock that sells on a daily basis. Her income will be for her healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mumah

texts.en: Mumah lives in New Kru town; she is 46 years old, single with 2 children aged 22 and 29, both of whom are in college and only one is living at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soft drinks. She says sometimes business is slow. She started this business by selling in the communities with the few goods she could afford, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business, and her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has three children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profits!' Her biggest challenge is 'Poor weather.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.'

Evelyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it has affordable rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Gives loans.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Evelyne replied 'it will bring in more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Evelyne owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodula is 51 years old and the mother of 3 children, her eldest is 27 and the youngest is 18. Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming since having her family, this has been their source of livelihood. 

Like most mothers, Teodula wanted her children to have a life that offers a brighter future. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance, so she requested a loan to be used for buying seedlings and fertilizers. The extra income that she can get from her business will be used for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives and works in New Kru Town, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Hawa is 38 years old, single with 4 children aged between 12 to 17, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past three years Hawa has been operating a small table market where she sells bed sheets. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with what little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bed sheets for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bed sheets for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children aged between 13 and 21. She sell home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and sweetened steamed cassava and cassava cake. Her husband works as a carpenter. With her help, they are able to provide for their children. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to buy more ingredients including cassava, sugar and coconut. In the future, Aida would like to expand her business, to provide her family with good food and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy coconut, cassava and sugar

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: This is 42 year old Ophelia from Liberia; precisely, she lives in New Kru Town of Montserrado County. This community is one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and her husband is a local businessman, they have four children between the ages of 22 and 27. Three of her children are presently in college and living on their own. She stopped her education at grade 10. For the past 20 years she has been involved with business, and presently she is selling fish. She started this business by selling on a table market and later received money from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She makes more profit and most interestingly she meets new people every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who support small business people.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Abigaie

texts.en:
Abigaie lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, over populated, but most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are transport options, some of the biggest markets in Liberia, and cheaper food.    
Abigaie is married, and her husband works as a steel bender. They have two children aged 8 and 13 who are currently attending school and living at home. Abigaie did not attend school; before starting her business she was involved with sales of cosmetics in the local market. With the loan proceeds she will buy more cosmetics to sell. She said "beside fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problems for now". With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business, and learned by seeing other businesswomen five years ago. She enjoys the flow of customers. Her dream is to move from table to shop business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, who is 43 years old, lives in New Kru town. She is married and her husband is a local businessman. They have three children whose ages are between 1 and 17. Among her three children, only two are attending school and they all live at home. 

Over the past six years, Evelyn has been operating a shop where she sells salt, sugar, coal, etc.  She says that the rainy season is her major challenge. She started this business by selling for her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, sugar, coal, etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to open a shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, sugar, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jebbeh

texts.en:
Jebbeh is 50 years old and lives in New Kru, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and has three children between 22 and 38 years old. Jebbeh did not attend school. 

For the past seven years, Jebbeh has been running a shop where she sells cold water. She started this business by selling for her aunt, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she earns good profits and it keeps her busy. She is also learning various local languages, which she enjoys. She is requesting a loan to buy more cold water to increase her business. Her future plans are to build another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cold water to increase her business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular region for growing bananas. He has four children and has been doing this work for years.  His primary income source comes from tea and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is earning the returns from farming. His biggest challenge is cattle rearing. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyansanako."

Kennedy was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "The loan requirements are favorable."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. Kennedy replied, "The products are financed by Juhudi."

His highest monthly expenses are his children's school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Kennedy replied, "Their basic needs will be taken care of."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kennedy owns a cow but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Biloa

texts.fr: Biloa est une femme de 46 ans celibataire, mère de 2 enfants de 12 et 22 ans qui vont à l'école. Elle commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise en soirée depuis plus de 10 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock  de poisson, charbon et condiments .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Biloa is a 46-year old woman who is single and mother to two children, aged 12 and 22 years old, both of whom are studying. She is a trader and has been selling braised fish at evening parties in one of the capital's districts for more than ten years. Her savoir-faire in this field relates to the prices at which she sells and this has enabled her to acquire a loyal customer base that is expanding day by day. This has led her to request a loan as her capital is no longer sufficient to fully satisfy her customer demand. The loan will enable her to increase her stock of fish, charcoal and condiments. The profits she makes as a result of this loan will be partly reinvested in her business and partly put aside for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish, charcoal and condiments.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular region for growing bananas. He has three children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income source comes from tea, crops and transportation services.

He says that what is most enjoyable about farming is cattle rearing. His biggest challenge is tea picking. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Simba."

Geoffrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Their loan requirements are fair."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, "loan repayment."

His highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Geoffrey replied, "Their needs will be easily taken care of."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Geoffrey owns a cow, poultry and motorcycle but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, TV and DVD but does not have electricity, running water or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is married and has two children, ages 2 and 5. She was unable to attend school before she started working, but she is good at managing her business. She has been involved in her business for the past five years. She sells tomatoes, pepper, red oil, etc. in the local market. 

With the loan, Watta will buy tomatoes, pepper, red oil, etc. to increase her sales. She says that aside from the fewer goods on her table market, she has no other problems at this time. She received some money from her husband to establish this business, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of her customers, and her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, pepper, red oil, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: Ruth est une femme de 41 ans commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise depuis 02 an dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock de poissons en achetant en carton ainsi que ses condiments.Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ruth is a 41-year-old woman and a trader. She has been selling braised fish for two years in a neighborhood of the capital. Thanks to her savoir-faire in this field and to the fact that her prices are reasonable, she has been able to build up a large and loyal customer base, which continues to grow. She is requesting this loan, since her capital is no longer sufficient for her to fully satisfy customer demand. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her stock of fish (by buying by the carton) as well as condiments. The profits generated as a result of this loan will be partly reinvested in her activity, while the rest will be put aside for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy crates of fish and condiments.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette est une femme de 49 ans celibataire, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 22 ans. Tous les 3 vont à l'école. Elle commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise en soirée depuis plus de 7 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock de poisson, charbon et condiments .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jeannette is a 49-year old woman who is single and mother to three children, aged from nine to 22 years old. All three children go to school. She is a trader and has been selling braised fish at evening parties in a district of the capital for more than seven years. Her savoir-faire in this field is her reasonable prices, which have enabled her to build up a loyal customer base, which continues to grow. She is requesting this loan since her capital is no longer sufficient to fully satisfy customer demand. Thanks to the loan she will be able to increase her stock of fish, charcoal and condiments. The profits which are generated as a result of the loan will be partly reinvested in her business and partly put aside for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish, charcoal and condiments.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: Vivianne est une femme de 36 ans mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 12 ans. Elle commerçante et vend  des beignets et du poisson en matinée depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (2 sacs de farine, 2 palettes de poisson, un bidon d'huile et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Vivianne is a 36-year old woman, who is married and mother to three children, whose ages range from four to 12 years old. She is a trader and has for the past three years been selling fritters and fish during the mornings in a district of the capital. Her savoir-faire in this field is her reasonable pricing, which has enabled her to build up a loyal customer base, which continues to grow. She is requesting this loan because her capital is not sufficient for her to fully satisfy customer demand. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her stock by buying two sacks of flour, two trays of fish, a container of oil and firewood. The profits generated as a result of this loan will be partly reinvested in her business and partly put aside for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of flour, two trays of fish, a container of oil and firewood.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from Vanadzor town. She is a hairdresser with 5 years of experience in that field. Due to her high professional skills, Ani has many customers and provides them with a high quality service. She is a hardworking woman and, despite her young age, Ani is able to sustain her family of 4: Ani herself, her parents and sister.

Now, to enlarge her skills in this field, Ani attends classes on tattoo making. For being able to work and make tattoos for her clients, Ani needs to purchase instruments. She has applied to SEF for help. Now she has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is highly important for Ani to be able to purchase instruments for tattooing and tools and materials for providing hairdressing services.

The loan will greatly assist Ani to work further and expand her skills as a hairdresser.

loans.use: to purchase instruments for tattooing and tools and materials for providing hairdressing services

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: léocadie est une femme de 43 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 ans et 28 ans. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Léocadie is a 43-year-old woman, engaged, and the mother of 3 children between the ages of 18 and 28. She opened a restaurant which she has run for many years. It is because of this restaurant that she is able to provide for her family. 

Purchasing products at retail prices for her restaurant business is not profitable for her. It is for this reason that this loan is important for her business, since it will allow her to increase her stock of food products (cartons of eggs, oil, 1 bag of rice, plates of fish, meat, raw vegetables, and the smaller items necessary for her to cook her restaurant's dishes.)

Léocadie will reinvest a portion of her profits into her business and use the rest to care for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of critical products for her restaurant

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married and her husband is a driver.  They each have two children ages 1 to 13; only 3 of their children are currently attending school and they all live at home. She did not attend school before starting her business of selling red oil 12 years ago.  With the loan proceeds, she will buy more red oil to sell at the market.  Aside from having too few goods to sell at her table at the market, she says she has no other problems.  With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish her business.  She says she enjoys the flow of costumers at her business. Her dream is to expand from a table business to a shop business.

loans.use: to buy more red oil to sell.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou est un homme qui habite à 15km de la commune ou se situe le guichet. Il est marié et père de famille, âgé de 39ans il évolue dans la commercialisation de bétails et il a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Il a besoin de ce crédit d’un montant de 500. 000F pour pouvoir acheter des moutons et bœufs et ensuite les revendre. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir il souhaite ouvrir une ferme dans sa localité avec l’aide des prêteurs. Modou est chargé de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Modou is a man who lives 15km from the office of his field partner.  He is a 39-year-old, married, father and has 10 years experience in the buying and selling of livestock.  Modou needs this loan of 500,000 francs CFA to be able to buy sheep and cattle and then resell them.  He starts his day at 6am and finishes at 7pm. 

In the future, he would like to open his own farm in the local area, with the help of further loans.  Modou is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine est une femme âgée de 43 ans, marié et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation de l’arachide et la transformation en patte d’arachide. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Madame Yacine est une habituée du Guichet et elle est  à son 3ème prêt. Vu la cherté de la vie et les conditions de vie précaires de sa famille, elle a pris la décision de prendre son destin en main et de faire du commerce .Ainsi elle a besoin de ce crédit d’un montant de 250.000 pour acheter des arachides, les transformer en patte et ensuite les revendre. Yacine commence sa journée à 8h pour ne revenir à la maison qu’à 19h. Avec l’aide de l’IMCEC elle souhaite développer son commerce et augmenter ses revenus
texts.en: Yacine is a 43-year-old woman, who is married, with children.  She buys peanuts to transform into peanut paste which she then sells.  She has 10 years experience in this business.  Yacine is well known to the field partner as this is her third loan from them.  As a result of the high cost of living and the insecure living conditions of her family, Yacine has decided to take control of her destiny through her business.  This is why she  needs this loan of 250,000 francs CFA to buy peanuts, which she makes into paste, and then sells.  She starts her day at 8am and doesn't return home until 7pm.  With the help of UIMCEC she wants to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Sube

texts.en: Sube is married with two children and resides in Panaon, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him in their farm planting vegetables to sell in town to make a living. She also has grown bananas on their farm. For the last five years she has earned 4,000 PHP (Philippine peso) monthly. She borrowed a loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new varieties of seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and use the profit to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
As a married father of four children, Jerry works hard to support his family.

He has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store.  Jerry is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

Jerry has been sustaining his business activities through his past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  Jerry hopes that his hard work will help him to attain his dream to save enough money to continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda live in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia.  Living conditions are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions and over-population, but rent is a bit cheaper, there are options to travel, New Kru contains one of the biggest market in Liberia and food costs less.  Finda is 38 years old, married with five children with ages between 7 and 13.  All of her children are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells candy, biscuits, peanuts etc.  She says sometimes sales go slowly. She started this business by selling around in the communities with her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, peanuts etc. for her business.  She hopes build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, peanuts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Melsida

texts.en:
Melsida is from Gyumri town where she lives with her husband and two grown-up children. She has been involved in the retail business for 8 years.  Melsida sells fruits and vegetables to neighboring villages to earn income for her family.  Her husband is a taxi driver and works hard to sustain his family. 
Currently, the family is facing financial difficulties and Melsida is not able to purchase supplies to sell to customers. Therefore, she is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.  Melsida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides businesses start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  This loan is very important in order for Melsida to be able to continue her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 47 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years.  She sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

Elna is requesting a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell. In the future, Elna would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr:
Roseline est une femme de 43 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 ans et 28 ans. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Roseline est une femme de 35 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle a ouvert un restaurant  qu'elle gère depuis 02 ans.Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir à ses  besoins
texts.en:
Roseline is a 35-year old woman, single without children. She opened a restaurant which she has run for two years.

Purchasing products for her restaurant at retail is not profitable for Roseline. It is for this reason that this loan is so important, since it will allow her to increase her stock of essential food products (cartons of eggs, cooking oil, 1 bag of rice, plates of fish, meat, raw vegetables, and the small items needed to cook her dishes).

She will reinvest a portion of her profits in the business and the remainder will help her provide for her needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of essential products

loans.name: Ndieynaba

texts.fr: DIEYNABA est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans le même quartier que le guichet, elle a le monopole dans la vente des poissons fumés et séchés. Ainsi elle sollicite ce montant pour aller dans les régions côtières s’acquérir une grande quantité de poissons fumés et séchés et les vend  à ses clients qui sont dans le marché. Dieynaba aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans et quitte sa maison à 8h pour n’y revenir que le soir vers les environs de 19h. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses capacités de stockages et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Dieynaba is a shopkeeper who is 29 years old and the mother of a family. She lives in the same neighborhood as the lending branch, and she has a monopoly in the sale of smoked and dried fish. She is now seeking this loan to be able to expand into neighboring regions, purchase a large quantity of smoked and dried fish, and to sell to her customers in the market.

Dieynaba helps her husband with the daily household expenses and the schooling costs for her children. She has more than 3 years of experience and leaves her home at 8am each morning, not to return  until 7pm. In the future she hopes to increase her quantity of stock and to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase dried and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: El Hadji Ibra

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibra est un aviculteur de profession, il est marié et père de famille. Très jeune il s’est responsabilisé en évoluant dans le commerce des œufs. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa petite famille et les frais de scolarité des ses enfants. Ibra commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Il a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des poules pondeuses et ensuite vendre les œufs. Il souhaite à l’avenir avec l’aide des prêteurs développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus afin de  pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibra is in the poultry business, married and the father of a family. He took on the responsibility of running an egg business at a very young age. He provides for the daily expenses of his small family and the schooling expenses for his children.

Ibra begins his day at 8am and works until 8pm. He needs these loan proceeds to purchase egg-laying hens in order to sell the eggs. In the future, with the help of his lenders, he hopes to grow his business and increase his profits in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase egg-laying hends to raise them and sell their eggs

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 34 years old and has three children. She is married and her children are in school.

Rhodora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 3 years. Rhodora requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

In the future, Rhodora would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Thelma has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Adelina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Adelina's business profile again for funding for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr: ALY est éleveur âgé de 43 ans marié et père de famille. Il habite à 8km de la commune ou se situe le Guichet et évolue dans le commerce de bétails. ALY a une expérience de plus de 10ans. Il commence sa journée à 9h et la termine à 20h. Il prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.ALY a besoin de ce crédit d’un montant de 250.000F pour aller dans les marchés hebdomadaires et acheter des moutons et des bœufs et ensuite venir dans sa localité et les revendre à ses clients. Avec l’aide de l’imcec il souhaite augmenter son cheptel et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Aly is a livestock raiser who is 43 years old and the father of a family. He lives 8km from the community where the lending branch is located, and is in the cattle business. Aly has more than 10 years of experience. He begins his day at 9am and finishes at 8pm. He is responsible for the daily expenses of his family and the schooling costs for his children.

Aly needs this loan of 250,000 francs CFA to go to the open air markets and purchase sheep and cows, and then return to his home area and resell them to his customers. With the help of UIMCEC he hopes to increase his livestock and to diversify his products.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to resell

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nelma is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelma has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from e-loading (prepaid mobile load credits).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is 45 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at an auto transportation center for one year. His wife is a janitor and works at a private firm. Ivan's daughter graduated from her high school this summer and has begun her study at university. His son is a ninth grade student in high school. 

Ivan is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fee. He thinks investing in his daughter's education is the best thing he can do for her.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made is a member of the Srikandi 1 Group. She is married and has two children. She has a pig breeding business and a garden, which she works on  with her husband. The harvest from the garden is usually used to meet their daily needs and to purchase feed for the pigs. 

Ni Made will use her share of the loan from MUK to buy piglets, additional feed, and vitamins. At the time of disbursement, Ni Made and the Srikandi 1 group proposes that in the next period the amount of the loan be bigger so that she can increase the number of pig and could expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Lkhamsuren

texts.en:
Lkhamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a wool collector at a cashmere factory for three years. Her husband works in the construction field during the summer and in the winter works at the cashmere factory. Their daughter graduated from her high school and enrolled in university. Their son goes to high school. 

Lkhamsuren is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay for her daughter's tuition fee. She thinks investing in education is the best thing she can do for her daughter. She and her husband don't want their children to be blue collar workers.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Precy works hard to support her family. She has a business selling sea-foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food production.  

Precy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc (NWTF) in order to buy more sea-foods to sell.

Precy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea-foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: Madame Magatte est une marchande ambulante qui vend des pagnes, draps et savons dans les artères du marché. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui est âgée de 46ans. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des draps, pagnes et savons pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché. Magatte aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour le terminer à 20h, elle a une expérience de plus de 8ans dans son activité. A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir sa propre boutique et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: Magatte is an itinerant saleswoman who sells pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing), sheets and soap in the alleyways of the market.  She is married, with children and is 46 years old.  She will use this loan to buy sheets, pagnes and soap to resell them in the market.  Magatte helps her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family.  She starts her day at 8am, and finishes at 8pm.  She has more than 8 years experience in her business.  In the future she would like to open her own shop, and expand the range of products she offers.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing), sheets and soap for resale.

loans.name: Alexandra Soraya

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando tuvo la iniciativa de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con el dinero que recibió del bono solidario, emprendió en el negocio del bazar.  Trabaja todos los días desde temprano con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Está en estado de unión libre y su esposo es cerrajero, tiene 3 hijos de 16 y 12 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal, y el último de 1 año.  Quisiera a futuro, mejorar su vivienda ya que lamentablemente, no cuenta con todos los servicios.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su bazar y adquirir materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  She started some time ago because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  Her business, a bazaar, was established with a government grant that she received.  She works every day, starting in the early morning hours, with the help of her children.  

The borrower is in a common-law relationship and her husband is a locksmith.  They have three children.  The two older children, age 16 and 12, attend a state school.  Her youngest child is one year old.  In the future she wants to improve her home, but unfortunately she does not have all basic services.  

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy merchandise for her bazaar and acquire construction materials.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bazaar and to acquire construction materials.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia tiene 23 años y nació en Neiva, Huila, población ubicada en el sur de Colombia. Es la hija menor de tres hermanos, sus padres son docentes en universidades públicas en Neiva y gracias a sus ahorros, Nathalia estudió Ingeniería Agroindustrial en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia ubicando el puesto 3 sobre 28 graduandos. 

Nathalia tiene el sueño de realizar un doctorado en desarrollo rural y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su doctorado y regrese a Colombia, Nathalia anhela trabajar en proyectos de desarrollo rural que mejoren la calidad de vida de las familias en el campo colombiano.

Aquí está su historia: 

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente, estoy vinculada como Joven Investigadora y trabajé como Asistente Docente en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia durante mis estudios de Maestría en Ciencia y tecnología de Alimentos, adicionalmente ese dinero lo destino para mi manutención. Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar este doctorado en el exterior. No me quiero dar por vencida para cumplir este objetivo y sé que gracias a mi excelencia académica y un gran esfuerzo puedo lograrlo.

Para mí sería un motivo de orgullo incalculable saber que puedo contribuir al progreso de las áreas rurales colombianas, pues Colombia tiene un gran potencial tanto en capital humano como en las riquezas naturales que su territorio ofrece. Soy consciente de que realizar un doctorado en un país desarrollado como Brasil, Alemania, Canadá, Nueva Zelanda u Holanda me daría las herramientas y el conocimiento necesario para logar este cometido. Además, es una gran oportunidad y será el motor para continuar perfilando mi carrera en el campo académico y ampliando mis perspectivas en el campo profesional. La única garantía que tengo es dar lo mejor de mí para cumplir mi sueño.
texts.en:
Nathalia is 23 years old. She was born in Neiva, Huila, a town located in the south of Colombia. She is the younger sister of her three brothers. Her parents are teachers at the public universities in Neiva and, thanks to their savings, Nathalia studied Agroindustrial Engineering at the National University of Colombia where she graduated 3rd out of 28 graduates. 

Nathalia dreams of completing a doctorate in rural development. She is seeking the support of Kiva to accomplish this goal because it is the only avenue available to cover the expenses of the language exams and her applications for the universities. Once she receives her doctorate and returns to Colombia, Nathalia seeks to work on rural development projects that will improve the quality of life of rural Colombian families.

Here is her personal story:

Even though I can count on the support of my family to complete this dream, my parents are not able to cover the high costs because of their limited economic situation. Today I am employed as a Junior Investigator and I worked as an Assistant Professor at the National University of Colombia during my studies for my Masters degree in Science and Nutrition Technology. The money from this work will be used to support myself. Kiva would supply the support that I need to be able to complete the first steps in this long journey and the motivation to pursue this doctorate abroad. I don't want to give up pursuing this goal and I know that thanks to my academic excellence and my strength I will be able to accomplish it. 

It would be an incalculable source of pride for me  to be able to contribute to the progress of the rural areas of Colombia. Colombia has great potential stemming from its human capital and the natural riches offered by its land. I know that completing a doctorate in a developed country like Brazil, Germany, Canada, New Zealand or Holland would give me the tools and knowledge I need to be able to achieve this task. Moreover, this is a great opportunity and it will be the engine of continued improvement in my academic career and it will expand my professional perspectives. The only guaranty that I have is to give the best of myself to complete my dream.

loans.use: to pay for the application fees for her doctorate in rural development.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
FATOU  est une jeune marchande de 25 ans, mariée. Son activité consiste à vendre des produits cosmétiques dans un marché de la place ou elle a ouvert une cantine depuis 4 ans. Elle est à son 5ème crédit à l’IMCEC ; et pour cette fois ci, elle veut doubler la somme pour augmenter son stock. Elle va acheter  des crèmes de beauté, des parfums, du savon, des tissus, des chaussures, du lait pour le corps... FATOU a une expérience de plus de 12 ans dans cette activité.
Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle n’a  pas  de charges et les bénéfices liés à son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et leur confort matériel.
texts.en: Fatou is a young saleswoman.  She is 25 years old and married.  She sells cosmetic products in a street market where she has run a small store for 4 years.  This is her 5th loan from UIMCEC, and this time, she has doubled the loan amount to enable her to buy more stock.  Fatou will buy beauty creams, perfumes, soap, fabric, shoes and body milk.  She has more than 12 years experience in this business.  Her day begins at 8am and finishes at 6pm.  She has no expenses and the earnings from her business will allow her to improve the standard of food and material comfort of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, perfumes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Verónica Elizabeth

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Desde muy joven le gustó esta actividad y siempre ha sido comerciante, ya que su papá le enseñó todo acerca del negocio.  Trabaja sola desde las 8 de la mañana hasta cuando se desocupe de sus labores.  Al momento está soltera, pero tiene 2 hijos que van a la escuela fiscal del sector donde habitan.  En un futuro, le gustaría terminar de construir su casa y comprar una camioneta para recorrer otros lugares con su mercadería.  Al momento necesita el crédito para la compra de una vitrina, ropa y sandalias para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  Since she was a young, she has enjoyed this business and always liked being a merchant.  Her father taught her everything about the business.  She works alone, starting at 8:00 A.M. until she is finished with all of her work.  At the moment, the borrower is single and her two children attend a state school in the area where they live.  In the future, she would like to finish the construction of her house and purchase a truck so that she can travel to other places with her merchandise.  

At the moment, the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy a display cabinet, clothes, and sandals to sell.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet, clothes, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Belegbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Belegbaatar, who is 46 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has earned a living by transporting fuel between ports and cities for the last three years. His wife is a decorator who works on orders from clients and various entities. Their elder son studies at university and their second son just enrolled there. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to pay for his second son's tuition. Using his savings, he paid his eldest son's tuition and believes that investing in his children's education is the best thing he can do for them.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica de 31 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, de 5 años de edad y 7 años de edad, ambos asistiendo a la escuela. Solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado debido a las dificultades económicas que tenia la familia. Su esposo es comerciante de ganado, compra y luego vende los animales a mejor precio. Únicamente sus dos hijos dependen de ella.

Tiene cerca de 3 años de dedicarse con su esposo a la compra y venta de ganado, su padre era ganadero y aprendió de él el cuido de los animales. Antes Verónica  vendía con su madre tamales, pupusas y otros antojos, pero se dio cuenta que el comercio de ganado da mas frutos.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de ganado para su posterior venta  y así obtener una buena ganancia esperando que  no bajen los precios de los animales.

El sueño de verónica, como todo padre responsable es que sus hijos puedan finalizar sus estudios en la universidad, tener buenas ganancias con lo que hace y ampliar las ventas.
texts.en: Veronica, 31, is married and has two children, ages 5 and 7. They are both in school. She was only able to go to school until sixth grade due to her family's economic difficulties. Her husband is a livestock trader. He buys them and then sells the animals at a better price. Her two children depend on her. For about three years, she has worked with her husband buying and selling livestock. Her father was a rancher and she learned how to care for the animals from him. Before, Veronica sold tamales, pupusas, and other street foods with her mother, but she realized that selling livestock bears more fruit. The loan will be used to purchase livestock to sell later and this way, earn a good profit if the price of the animals does not go down. Like all responsible parents, Veronica's dream is for her children to finish their studies at university, and also for her to earn good profits from her business and expand her sales.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alvin

texts.es: Alvín  tiene la edad de 35 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y dos  hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a él y a su familia a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alvin is 35 years old, he is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle and make a profit by selling them when they are fully grown. The cattle business will help him and his family get ahead in life. He expects this project to grow and that he will achieve his objectives, giving his family a better quality of life and improved financial stability in the future. This is the first loan that he has received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans previously from state banks. However FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en: Ni Wayan is the leader of the Srikandi 2 loan group and is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed for them to eat. Ni Wayan was unable to be in this photo because she was ill and is represented here by her daughter, who we see raising her hand. At this time the number of members was reduced to seven because one had to resign from the group. In addition to raising animals, Ni Wayan is a housewife who has two adult children, both of whom are married. Her goal for the future is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Mr. Battur is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts for two years. His wife is a cook and works at a hospital. Their son is a fifth grade student at high school and their daughter goes to kindergarten.

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a plot of land and planks. Next year, he wants to plant vegetables on that land and as a protection against stray cattle, he wants to fence it using planks.

loans.use: to purchase land and planks.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single mother of eight children with six children in school and two adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
Waridi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to rent the land, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 28-year-old, divorced Iraqi woman and she has two children. When Wafa was divorced in 2008, she had no means to support herself and her children, so she decided to buy an old sewing machine and start her own business to feed her children. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work. 

Wafa is requesting a loan from Izdiharona for Economic Development to buy an air conditioner, an iron, a generator, and a sewing machine to increase her production. She is aiming to increase her profits by having a better machine, longer hours of electricity supply, and more comfortable working conditions, so that she may continue providing the best life to her children. 

The story of Wafa and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, an iron , a generator, and sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives and works near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This made Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Mary is married, and has nine children. Both she and her husband are farmers, and have been in this business for ten years. They are currently growing maize and vegetables on their land, as well as tending to dairy animals and raising poultry. 

Mary is excited to become a beekeeper because she sees it as a profitable activity that also helps protect the environment. This is her’s first loan, and she plans to use the income to top up the funds she has for paying her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a married woman with four children, three of whom go to school. She has operated a kerosene-selling business for the past two years and says that transportation costs are her major challenge. She is requesting this loan to buy kerosene to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to resell

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio de 59 años de edad, casado,  reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país el trabaja como chofer de una línea de transporte, en la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia, él es una persona trabajadora, honesta, de buenos principios y sobre todo responsable, uno de sus sueños es poder hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, ya que debido a sus bajos recursos no había  podido hacer las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda, actualmente él solicita crédito para la instalación de cerámica para tener mejores condiciones de vida, mejorar completamente su vivienda ha sido uno de sus mayores sueños desde hace muchos años, con el préstamo anterior él pudo hacer mejoras en el techo de su casa y ahora en el invierno no le afecta en nada las lluvias, el afirma que los prestamos recibidos le han cambiado la vida de su familia haciendo mejoras para tener una condición de vida más estable.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is 59 years old, married and lives in the department of Chinandega in the west of the country. He works as a driver for a transport company. He struggles day to day to provide a netter future for his family. He is an honest, hard-working, high-principled and most of all responsible person. One of his dreams is to improve his house. But due to his modest resources he can't make the necessary improvements to his home.

Francisco Antonio is requesting this loan to install ceramic tiles to have better living conditions. Completely renovating his house has been one of his dreams for quite a few years now. With the last loan he was able to work on the roof of his house and now in the winter the rains no longer affect them. He affirms that the loans have changed the life of his family for the better, providing more stable living conditions

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, tiles, sand, gravel etc.

loans.name: Augusto León

texts.es: Augusto es un hombre de 27 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 2 años y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante 9 años se ha dedicado a ejercer la labor de barbería, inicialmente como empleado durante 3 años y luego, con la experiencia y conocimientos obtenidos, decidió independizarse y montar su propia barbería, trabaja todos los días y cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleados. Su negocio surgió de la necesidad de adquirir más recursos económicos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia. El cliente se caracteriza por ser activo, alegre, pujante y con un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone. Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 sillas hidráulicas de barbero, esto le permitirá ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad al momento de prestar el servicio y además dará una mejor imagen y crecimiento al establecimiento, permitiendo el aumento de las ventas. Augusto sueña con abrir varias sucursales en diferentes puntos estratégicos de la ciudad y además desea capacitarse en el exterior, para ampliar sus conocimientos y mejorar su técnica, pero sabe que para lograrlo debe trabajar con empeño, dedicación y mucha disciplina, esta es la clave para que pueda seguir progresando y sacar adelante a su hijo a su esposa, brindándoles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Augusto, 27, is the father of a 2-year-old son, and he lives in a common-law marriage with his significant other. He has worked as a barber for nine years. Initially, he was an employee for three years, and then with experience and the knowledge he gained, he decided to break away and open his own barber shop. He works every day and has the support of two employees. His business grew out of the need to earn more money, which would allow him to safeguard the wellbeing of his family. He is active, happy, strong, and has an enterprising spirit, which has enabled him to achieve the goals he sets for himself. He is asking for the loan to buy two hydraulic barber chairs. This will let him offer his customers greater comfort while he is providing his services, and it will also give a better image and greater growth to the business, allowing an increase in sales. Augusto dreams of opening several branches in strategic parts of the city and he also wants to train abroad in order to expand his knowledge and improve his technique. But he knows that to achieve it, he needs to work with determination, dedication, and a lot of discipline. This is the key for him to keep moving forward and advance his son and wife, providing them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two hydraulic barber chairs

loans.name: Wajdy

texts.en:
Wajdy is a 28-year-old man and father of two children whom he loves very much. He has been operating an electrical workshop for many years in the middle of Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to improve his family`s living standards. 

He benefited from the first loan that enabled him to expand his business to offer good services for his clients. 

Now, he would like to expand his business more in order to increase profit. It is for this reason that he is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix different cars for his clients. 

He is grateful for Kiva lenders who financed him the first loan.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix different cars for his clients.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is 28; he is married and has one little child. His parents live with him and are the pensioners. Five years ago, Tehran established his business of selling daily use goods and agriculture items of his own production. He runs his shop together with his mother.

His business is located in the village where he lives, and his main customers are locals. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns his family income from this business.
 
The month of September is the beginning of study in schools, and so he decided to start selling school items, such as exercise books, pens, pencils and so on.

Tehran would like a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN in order to pay for school items. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and increase his profit.

In the future, he plans to expand his business and establish a new stall for the sale of school items, and hopes to be able to make enough profit to educate his child and support his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase school items, such as exercise books, pens, and pencils to sell.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a 35-year-old farmer. He is married and has four children. Hamid has a three beautiful girls in school, Isra , Nuha and Muntaha. They are very smart and always get high grades in school. Every year the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover school fees, uniforms, and books. He is requesting a loan to pay for his daughters' tuition fees and other school expenses. With this loan they can accommodate all these expenses and keep the beautiful smiles on their faces. 

The story of Hamid and his daughters is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients that are able to get a better education.

loans.use: A loan for 1,500 helps Hamid to pay for his daughters' education.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman; she is taking out a loan for her son, who needs to buy a new body for his auto rickshaw. Her son has been driving this type of vehicle for many years in Lahore, Pakistan and does this by day and night to earn maximum profit. A few weeks ago, while driving he was in an accident which seriously damaged the vehicle. Now his passengers feel uncomfortable while traveling, and she is requesting a loan so that he can repair the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly again. Her son is responsible for his children, and her children are fully dependent upon her son. Parveen wishes to extend her thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of a son.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years and getting an income for his family, but now it requires proper maintenance due to continuously running over under-constructed roads. 
For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan for her husband so that he could maintain the rickshaw. He wants to buy a tire and pay for some engine maintenance. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services for his passengers. 
Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of a rickshaw.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush is from the village Lernagog of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. Anush works in the local school as a librarian. However, her salary is so low, that she cannot fully cover her family's daily needs. Anush and her family members are engaged in cattle breeding. Her husband and son assist her a lot during the farming activities; they help her in realizing the agricultural products in the local market. The cattle breeding is the main source of income for the family. To be able to maintain and continue it, Anush needs a loan of USD 1800 to purchase forage for the livestock. The lenders' support will be highly appreciated and will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family in sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock

loans.name: Abdulkaream

texts.en:
Abdulkaream, 36, is married and has six children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells consumer staples to his clients. He started his business with a small capital which he used for his business. 

He will use the loan to buy products to stock his store such as sweets, soft drinks, and groceries. In this way, he can increase his working capital. The reason he is requesting this loan of 200,000 YER from AMB is to buy grocery items like soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. for his business is because he doesn't have enough money to buy everything that he needs. 

He faces challenges with his business such as the competition. He will use the profits to purchase a lot more merchandise so that he can continue to keep his store well stocked. His dream for his business is to have a stable and profitable business. He is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided with this loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, such as soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Thamina's Group

texts.en:
Thamina is a 44-year-old married Iraqi woman. She has four children. Thamina mastered this skill for 13 years. She has an old machine that she uses to assist her husband in providing their family's income.

She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.

Thamina is requesting a loan from Izdiharona to buy an air cooler, generator, and new sewing machine so she can work longer hours during the hot season, and increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing the family income.
 
The story of Thamina and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .

loans.use: to buy an air cooler, generator, and sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y  tiene tres hijos, ambos asisten ala escuela. María solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, su esposo tiene un vehículo en el que realiza viajes particulares y con ellos lleva sustento a la familia.

Tiene una tienda, su madre le enseño como administrarla, se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana hace el desayuno , luego manda sus hijos a la escuela. El resto del día lo dedica a la tienda.

El préstamo será utilizado para cambiar el techo de la casa, esta en muy mal estado y teme por la seguridad de su familia. En un futuro le gustaría construir su casa de ladrillo, actualmente vive en una de adobe y se desgasta con cada época lluviosa y la mercadería se le daña.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old, she is married and she has three children who attend school. María was only able to complete the 9th grade. Her husband has a car that he hires for private travel and from this they sustain their family.

She has a store that she learned how to manage from her mother. She gets up at 5 am every day to make breakfast and take her children to school. The rest of the day she works in the store.
